statement.title: Content
statement.content:
Farmer John has three milking buckets of capacity $A$, $B$, and $C$ liters. Each of the numbers $A$, $B$, and $C$ is an integer from $1$ through $20$, inclusive. Initially, buckets $A$ and $B$ are empty while bucket $C$ is full of milk. Sometimes, FJ pours milk from one bucket to another until the second bucket is filled or the first bucket is empty. Once begun, a pour must be completed, of course. Being thrifty, no milk may be tossed out.

Write a program to help FJ determine what amounts of milk he can leave in bucket $C$ when he begins with three buckets as above, pours milk among the buckets for a while, and then notes that bucket $A$ is empty.

statement.title: Standard Input
statement.content: A single line with the three integers  $A$, $ B$, and $C$.

statement.title: Standard Output
statement.content: A single line with a sorted list of all the possible amounts of milk that can be in bucket $C$ when bucket $A$ is empty.

statement.title: Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
8 9 101 2 8 9 10
